Reviews.Author: TorontoDukey
Reviews.Content: Moved to this hotel for the convenience of being in the Gaslamp district. The hotel itself is nothing to brag about, especially when the first half of your trip is in a really good hotel (Sophia). But the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Really not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: radioclashx
Reviews.Content: Location cannot be beat. The room was small and nothing special but did have a refrigerator. I also liked the business center where they had three computers with internet access and a printer which came in handy several times for getting directions. Has a nice little courtyard where you can sit and a full breakfast included in the price of the room. No pool obviously, but the location is great and the place is decent for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in So-So”
Reviews.Author: chickonamission
Reviews.Content: We knew what we were getting ourselves into, thanks to lots of reviews. Room was small, had a sink in the bedroom. But it was cheap compared to other hotels in the Gaslamp Quarter and we knew we wouldn't be spending a ton of time in it. Room was mostly fine - the bed wasn't spectacular and the elevator was slow. The location couldn't be beat. Close to everything. We parked our car for the entire time we were there because we could walk everywhere. Staff was pretty surly. Weren't very helpful with very local directions and they closed their breakfast down early. I don't know, I think that's annoying. If you say breakfast is until 9:30, don't shut it down at 9:15. And the great free breakfast they provide is basically frozen sausages, bacon etc that they stick in the microwave. Pretty inedible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Gaslamp Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: SonomaCoasters
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to restaurants and entertainment on Fourth and Fifth Avenue as well as Horton Plaza. Easy walking distance to public transportation on Broadway. Our room was compact and clean (avoid the first floor if you're a light sleeper). Breakfast was better than the usual continental. Front desk staff were very helpful with transportation arrangements to and from the airport. Try Buca di Beppo (next door) for Italian food in a kitschy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice touches;”
Reviews.Author: OctopusUK
Reviews.Content: Just return from an enjoyable stay at this hotel. The price was a bit more than I'd like to pay, $150, but for that price you get service. Firstly breakfast is included and this is more than the usual conitinetal - it included freshly made waffles, cheese omletts and meat items. Also during the day, coffee, tea, fruit and danish's are available. The hotel also has free internet access from 3 PC's (I never had to wait for a PC) and a laundry (2 x 75c a wash/dry). The location is great, *just* outside the Gaslamp quarter so it is quiet but after two blocks walk, you are in the heart of downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but....”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid36
Reviews.Content: The price to be paid for the excellent location in the bustling Gaslamp area was that the facilities in this hotel are rather cramped. Parking behind the hotel is available, but at an extra $14 nightly. The bedroom was clean and tidy but the room was small and, unusually, awkwardly housed the washbasin; the bathroom being simply the shower and the loo. The single Queen bed was rather uncomfortable with a 'let's all roll towards the middle' type matress. And there were no bedside tables and reading lamps.Reception staff tried hard to be pleasant in a busy atmosphere, but were a little short on rapid and efficient response. The 'complimentary' breakfast was modest though sufficient, although the dining area is again rather cramped. The launderette facilities could be very useful to those on extended tours and overall the shortfalls described above were to some extent compensated for by the convenience of this hotel's close proximity to the vibrant Gaslamp area of San Diego with all it's bars and restaurants..

Reviews.Title: “I must agree: Small room, but cozy and cannot beat location”
Reviews.Author: NaptownTraveler
Reviews.Content: While we kept the majority of our week and a half's worth of garments at the Clarion Hotel in Anaheim, we packed two nights worth of clothing and beauty produtcs in a duffle bag for San Diego and the famed Gaslamp District. I have been familiar with the Comfort Inn brand and the rooms can be small and just a step above motel standard setup, but the rooms here are very tiny. That being said, however, the rooms at Comfort Inn Gaslamp are very efficiently put together and just the right size for a couple who does not mind close quarters or have a lot of luggage. There is more than meets the I in these rooms. There was a mini-fridge, coffee maker, microwave, full size ironing board and steam iron (you just do not know how rare it can be to get a steam iron in a hotel sometimes), good water pressure in the shower, and plenty of drawers and lighting. Plus the little extras, like the cute courtyard with the mini-fountains, the beautifully decorated lounge area with the tropical fish tank, adequate business center and complimentary continental breakfast (with the famous Comfort Inn Waffles of course) make this hotel feel much more than just an older urban lodge. Not to mention the location! The Padres were playing and parking was expensive at a lot down the street ($14/night), but the desk tipped us to park early before the spaces fill up for the game that evening. We left our car there and walked around the area. There are some of the best restaurants in California just 1-2 blocks away and great shopping at several local stores and the downtown mall (fresh air mall of course in CA.) The nightlife is not to be missed if you are under 35 (in real age or in spirit.) It will take you back to those good ol college days for sure! It can get chilly in the evening, so be sure to bring a light sweater or wind-breaker type of jacket. We visited in the middle of June and it was hot during the day. If there is any cloudiness in the forecast, go to the SD Zoo, or SD Zoo's Wild Animal Park. The animals are more active when there isn't direct sun. All in all, we will probably visit this Comfort Inn again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Friendly Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rachel805
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute at hotels.com for about $135/night in late May. Parking was another $14. The room was tiny on a ground floor with a window that looked across at the housekeeping room. But the staff was extremely friendly, the continental breakfast just fine, and the location was in superb walking distance to so many great restaurants. Recommend Ramas - fantastic. For a good price and great location would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: jessitemecula
Reviews.Content: I read alot of viewer reviews about the location. It is awesome. I liked the simple rooms. They were well maintaned and very clean. The rooms are very simple but had everything I needed. Most impressive part of the hotel was the free breakfast. They have something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly but great location”
Reviews.Author: Quiquine
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a few blocks from trolley and great restaurants and bars. Room looked like a dental office with neon light and no decoration, but at least it was very clean. It had no view at all. Fridge and microwave in room (just close to the sink, I did not like having toiletries just next to the cofee machine and microwave, but anyway...), safe. 3 PC with free internet in "Business center" with free coffee. Would go back just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room #116!!!”
Reviews.Author: rab123
Reviews.Content: The original assigned room was the worst room I have experience in nearly 35 years of travel. AC was terrible, window unit that didn't work well. About 150 square feet of space. Sink outside of bathroom, 2 feet from the bed! Just terrible!! I was moved the second night, after much pleading, to an acceptable room. Price no bargain for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible...”
Reviews.Author: BobC357
Reviews.Content: In town for a convention, big hotels are booked or overpriced. Comfort Inn is really not too bad. Within easy walking distance to the convention center. Yes, the rooms are small and there's noise from the street, but this is Gaslamp and there's lots of activity outside. The room is clean and the staff is friendly. Microwave, refrigerator & coffee maker in the room. Free wireless Internet. Free shuttle from the airport, free 'breakfast'; I really can't complain. Are they really going to charge me 50 cents per day for the room safe? Expect to pay about half of what the Marriott, Hilton or Hyatt is charging. For that kind of money, Comfort Inn is worth it; otherwise, you might find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more to stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MrsVerloop
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked a room for one night, since we were attending a concert nearby. We arrived and were grateful that we were allowed to check in early. It was so hot and humid outside, that we were looking forward to relaxing in a cool room. Comfort Inn charges $14 for parking in their lot, unfortunately for us the lot was full. When we asked where we should park, the only reply we received was, "There are other lots around." A little rude, but no biggy, we could find parking somewhere. When we got up to our room it was hotter than it was outside. The hotel has no central AC, so we had to rely on a window cooler. After we had the cooler on for an hour and there was no change in the room temperature, I called down to the front desk. I explained to the lady that I was unsure if the cooler was broken or if I just wasnt working it properly. Her reply was, "If it's blowing out air its working." I told her that it was blowing out air, but it was not cold air. She repeated her above statement and hung up. Decided that maybe it just took a liitle while to really work, so we got ready and went to the concert. When we returned a few hours later, the room was the same temperature as when we left (this was at 1 a.m.) We tried to sleep, but by 3 we had to get up and take cold showers, since we were starting to feel sick since it was so warm. We left the next morning with only 3 hours sleep and a very unpleasant experience. The room was decorated nicely, and they offer you breakfast in the morning. But, when we return to San Diego next month I will spend the extra money for my comfort to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn was a very convenient location for our San Diego trip. The room was a bit small and there was a significant amount of street noise, but the bed was comfortable and room was clean. The staff at the hotel were among the friendliest I have encountered. There is an continental breakfast, and FREE wireless internet. I would recommend requesting a room that does not face the street, which should make for a much quieter night's sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Gaslamp / Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: 660 G St, San Diego, CA 92101
